FuncDef:
The delay-measure one-way threshold command sets an alarm threshold for one-way frame delay measurement.
The undo delay-measure one-way threshold command removes the alarm threshold set for one-way frame delay measurement.
By default, no alarm threshold is configured for one-way frame delay measurement.

ParaDef.Info:
Sets an alarm threshold for one-way frame delay measurement.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295, in microseconds.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To set an alarm threshold for one-way frame delay measurement that monitors link quality, run the delay-measure one-way threshold command. If the delay exceeds the configured threshold, an alarm is generated and sent to the NMS. An administrator obtains alarm information and takes measures to rectify the fault that causes the delay to ensure service quality.
The delay-measure one-way threshold command can be used in the VLAN scenario.
Prerequisites
An MD and an MA have been created using the cfm md and ma commands, respectively.
